questions.question_text:
You have enabled logging on your FortiGate device for Event logs and all Security logs, and you have set up logging to use the FortiGate local disk.
What is the default behavior when the local disk is full?

choices.A: Logs are overwritten and the only warning is issued when log disk usage reaches the threshold of 95%.
choices.D: No new log is recorded after the warning is issued when log disk usage reaches the threshold of 95%.
choices.B: No new log is recorded until you manually clear logs from the local disk.
choices.C: Logs are overwritten and the first warning is issued when log disk usage reaches the threshold of 75%.

discussion.content: C is Correct First warnig 75%, second 90% and final Warning 95%
C correct. FortiGate_Security_6.4 page 270

Selected Answer: C
C is correct due to:
Page 278 Fortigate Security 7.0(New Version!!), only 75% of the disk is available to store logs, this is distributed in the existing vdoms. 

diagnose sys logdisk usage -- CLI command to verify this

Selected Answer: C
C is correct 
Ref: 
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.4.0/cli-reference/462620/log-disk-setting
You have enabled logging on your FortiGate device for Event logs and all Security logs, and you have set up logging to use the FortiGate local disk.

Selected Answer: C
Correct
C is correct. "The system reserves approximately 25% of its disk space for system usage and unexpected quota overflow."
C is correct
It`s A because overwrite in 95% only warning in 75%
C are correct
C is correct
C is correct
C is correct
C is correct
C is correct

questions.question_text: Which three CLI commands can you use to troubleshoot Layer 3 issues if the issue is in neither the physical layer nor the link layer? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
BCD are correct....”dia sys top” is not for troubleshooting layer 3 issues rather for troubleshooting CPU and Memory issues

REF: Infrastructure_6.4_study_Guide Page 416

B, C & D is correct
FortiGate_Infrastructure page 57 for "D"

diagnose sys top - list of processes with most CPU
get system arp - show interface, IP, MAC (physical layer)

Selected Answer: BCD
Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 pg 145
"besides traceroute and ping there are other tools for troubleshooting"
Diag sniffer and diag debug flow are specifically mentioned.

BCE
E - ARP shows L3 - L2 bindings which is helpful during the IP confict troubleshooting

Selected Answer: BCD
Infrastructure_7.0_study_Guide Page 145

Selected Answer: BCD
BCD are correct

Selected Answer: BCD
dia sys top” is not for troubleshooting layer 3 issues rather for troubleshooting CPU and Memory issues
B,C,D estão correctos!!!

Selected Answer: BCD
B & C & D is Correct. No Doubt.

Selected Answer: BCE
FortiGate Infrastructure 7.0 Study Guide, p. 353, 354:
"If you suspect that there is an IP address conflict.....you may need to look at the ARP table" - get system arp (ans. E), and two other answers, B and C - execute ping, execute traceroute.
Arp table it's a layer 2, Execute Top it's a system command, the other 3 are correct.

Selected Answer: BCD
B;C;D are correct ones.

Selected Answer: BCD
B, C & D is correct
Answerr Incorrect, correct answer is BCD, option A it's to see process
B & C & D is Correct. No Doubt.
B C D ~~~

comments.content: BCD are correct A it's not cauz the command is to list the processes running

discussion.content: ABC are Correct

Correct Answers: C and D

C: "Operating mode is per-VDOM setting. You can combine transparent mode VDOM's with NAT mode VDOMs on the same physical Fortigate.

D: "Inspection-mode selection has moved from VDOM to firewall policy, and the default inspection-mode is flow, so NGFW Mode can be changed from Profile-base (Default) to Policy-base directly in System > Settings from the VDOM" Page 125 of FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4_Study_Guide

A and B are incorrect: "The firmware on your Fortigate and some settings, such as system time, apply to the entire device-they are not specific to each VDOM. Page 128 of FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4_Study_Guide

Selected Answer: CD
Settings for each VDOM:
- Op. Mode
- NGFW Mode
- Routes and interfaces
- Firewall Policies
C and D

Selected Answer: CD
C. Choose NAT or Transparent mode.
D. Choose NGFQ Profile or Policy mode.

Selected Answer: CD
Infrastructure Study Guide p.125
"NGFW per VDOM"
"Operation mode per VDOM"

Selected Answer: CD
C. Choose NAT or Transparent mode.
D. Choose NGFQ Profile or Policy mode.
C & D ARE THE CORRECT ANSWER
C & D are correct i'm sure

questions.question_text: Which two settings can be separately configured per VDOM on a FortiGate device? (Choose two.)

An administrator does not want to report the logon events of service accounts to FortiGate.
What setting on the collector agent is required to achieve this?

choices.B: Add user accounts to the FortiGate group filter
choices.C: Add user accounts to Active Directory (AD)
choices.A: Add the support of NTLM authentication
choices.D: Add user accounts to the Ignore User List

discussion.content: D its. FG Infraest SG 7.0 page 290

comments.content: The FFSO Collector agent ignores any login event that match the Ignore Users List

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
FortiGate_Infrastructure_7.0 page 278
D Correct
D is right answer
D is Correct. No doubt.
Yes D is correct.
D is correct. FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 288

BC 
FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 136 = A is incorrect Layer 2 transparent mode
FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 113 = D is incorrect Internet access is recommended because specific services, such as web filtering using the public FortiGuard servers

BC is correct

The answer is BC

I got this question on NSE4 7.0 exam yesterday and it was a one-answer question with answer C being different.
On the exam the answer C was "A DEFAULT static route is NOT required on the To-Internet VDOM to allow LAN users to access the Internet."

comments.content: So are you saying that the new C is correct on v7.0? I was under the impression that a default route was always necessary when pointing at the internet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
As already sayd by others: B and C

comments.content: Infra P136 : you connot crate inter-vdom between layer2 transparent mode vdoms

discussion.content: AD correct

Selected Answer: BC
BC is correct
B & C ARE correct
What about D, root vdom need internet for fortiguar services

comments.content: exactly. that is why d is wrong - and we are seeking the right answers here ;)

discussion.content: B&C is correct: https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD46542
BC is correct
B,C is correct..no doubt
BC is correct
"CD" is the correct answer.
A is incorrect. FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 136 - you cannot create an inter-VDOM link between Layer 2 transparent mode VDOMs. At least one of the VDOMs must be operating in NAT mode.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The Root and To_Internet VDOMs are configured in NAT mode. The DMZ and Local VDOMs are configured in transparent mode.
The Root VDOM is the management VDOM. The To_Internet VDOM allows LAN users to access the Internet. The To_Internet VDOM is the only VDOM with internet access and is directly connected to ISP modem.
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Inter-VDOM links are not required between the Root and To-Internet VDOMs because the Root VDOM is used only as a management VDOM.
choices.A: Inter-VDOM links are required to allow traffic between the Local and DMZ VDOMs.
choices.C: A static route is required on the To-Internet VDOM to allow LAN users to access the Internet.
choices.B: Inter-VDOM links are required to allow traffic between the Local and Root VDOMs.
